Nerangs.ab: barsom sih ud sē tāg ud frāgām dō tāg barsom bastan ud parāhōm kardan sāzišn hamāg frāz nihādan ud ān kas kē zōtīh kāmēd kardan aṣ̌əm vohū ēk guftan ud dast pad pādyāb kardan

"The barsom (consists of) 33 twigs and the frāgām are two. He should tie the barsom, prepare the parāhōm and dispose all the implements. The one who wishes to perform in the office of zōt should recite one aṣ̌əm vohū and wash his hands with pādyāb."

ab.ab: NērangVVrS0.1 (Nērang ī āb) [mss. 4000 4010 4020 4025 4063], cf. WiD, Revāyat of Kāma Bohra (MU1, p. I. 577) and Revāyat of Kāmdin Šapur (var. b) (MU1, p. I. 584), on the Nērang ī Āb ud Padyāb ceremony:

ōy kē zōtīh kāmēd kardan dast pad pādyāb bē kunišn, ēk-bār gōmēz ud āb bē nigerišn. hamāg gyāgīhā pēš gōmēz ud pas āb nigerišn. hamāg gyāgīhā ān-ī wāzag kē ō pēš nibēsam bē gōwišn bē estišn. gōmēz ud āb bē nigerišn pas abastāg bē rāyēnišn.

The one who wishes to take the office of the zōt, has to wash his hands with pādyāb and gaze once at the gōmēz and the water. Each time, he has to gaze first at the gōmēz and then at the water. Each time, he has to recite the words that I write in the following. He has to stand and gaze at the gōmēz and the water. Then he has to arrange the abastāg.
Revāyat of Kāmdin Šapur (var. a) (MU1, pp. I. 579-580), on the Nērang ī Āb ud Padyāb ceremony:

(Pāz.) zōt̰. ẏaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. 5 guftan u. darust. niṣ̌astan. u. dast. ba. ātaš. dāštan. nīrəṇg. bar. gə̄raftan. u. bar. miiąna. aravīs. ādušt. bi. rāsti. tə̄cai. ādušt. nihādan. u. ṣ̌iša. bar. kināriš. nihādan. caną̇n. ki. ba. ẏak. dīgar. ni. zanṇt̰. u. nīrəṇg. guną̇. kirdan. ki. adušt. ki. ṣ̌ōiiṇt̰. āv. baṣ̌īša. narasat̰. u. pas. pāδiiāv. kardan. dast. ba. ātaš. daštan. u. nīrəṇg. u. [†āv] nigarīdan. himājā. aval. nīrəṇg. u. pas. āv. nigirīdan.

The zōt should recite five yaϑā ahū vairiiō and stay seated erected, he should hold the hand over the fire, take the nērang and place it in the middle between the urvīs and the ādušt, on the empty right side of the ādušt. The vessel (of water) should be placed at his side, in such a way that they do not touch each other. The nērang should be so that the water with which the ādušt is cleaned, does not reach the vessel of water. Afterwards, the hands should be purified and put over the fire. The nērang and the water should be watched, always first the nērang and then the water.
Revāyat of Behdin Ǧāsā (MU1, p. I. 592), on the Nērang ī Āb ud Padyāb ceremony:

(Pers.) ānkas yašt ḫᵛāhad kard dar pāy istad va panǧ ahunavar beḫᵛānad ḫešnumani soruš pas moḥkam benšinad con vāz gereft dast-e cap rā pādyāv karde dast-e cap pādyāv šoste dast-e rāst beātaš dārad sar-e gomiz bengarad pas saraš benahand degar dast beātaš barad digar sar-e āb bardārad benegarad saraš benahand hamā sāǧešn benegarešn pas avarḫizad barābar-e ādušt beistad va ašim vohu beguyad hamā sāǧešn ḫub benegarad

Then he who is to perform the cermony, should stand up and recite five Ahunavars (with) the šnūman of Srōš. Then he should stand firm, as when the wāz is taken. He should purify his left hand, (i.e., wash his left hand with the pure water), hold the right hand over the fire, take up the lid of the vessel of urine and look at the urine. Then the top of it should be covered and he should again hold his hand over the fire and take up the lid of the vessel of water and look at it and cover it again. All the apparatus should be looked at. Then getting up, he should stand just opposite the adūšt, recite one aṣ̌əm vohū, and look well at all the apparatus.
